page.title: 10TOURISM (HUNDAY MUSEUM)
page.content: {HUNDAY MUSEUM }IS SET IN BEAUTIFUL WOODED GROUNDS,WITH A SMALL LAKE ABOUT A MILE FROM THE MAIN COMPLEX.TWO YEARS AGO A NARROW GAUGE RAILWAY OPENED TO TAKE VISITORS AROUND THE LAKE.THE ENGINE WAS BOUGHT FROM A COALMINE SO IT IS COMPLETELY SPARKPROOF.THE ROUND TRIP TAKES ABOUT 30 MINUTES BUT PROBLEMS CAN ARISE DUE TO THE TRACK BEING ON AN INCLINE.IN WET WEATHER THE RAILS BECOME SLIPPERY SO THE TRAIN WHEELS CANNOT GRIP,WHICH IS MOST LIKELY TO HAPPEN IF THERE IS A FULL LOAD OF PASSENGERS.ON MY FIRST TRIP THE DRIVER ATTEMPTED THE INCLINE 4 OR 5 TIMES BEFORE ADMITTING DEFEAT AND AND ASKING EVERYONE TO WALK BACK TO THE MUSEUM,FORTUNATELY NOT FAR.THERE IS A CAFETERIA SERVING DELICOUS HOME COOKED FOOD AND A PICNIC AREA FOR THOSE WHO PREFER IT.THIS UTILISES OLD MILLSTONES AS TABLES AND TRACTOR SEATS
